testcase.name: AddPlayer > emits an "add-player" event with the input value when the form is submitted
AddPlayer > clears the input when the form is submitted
Link and button text > Link text is "Logout", when isLoggedIn is true
Link and button text > "Go to register" by default in link, "login" by default in button
Link and button text > Text is "Go to login" when isLoggedIn is false and Link is clicked once, "register" in button
Logout: Emited events > emits "logout" event when isLoggedIn is true and the logout link is clicked
submit > emits "login" event with username and password when isLogin is true
submit > emits "register" event with username and password when isLogin is false
ListPlayer > renders a list item with the player's id as its id
ListPlayer > displays the player name inside the anchor element
ListPlayer > emits a "player-clicked" event with the player id when the player is clicked
ListPlayer > anchor should be focusable via the keyboard (by pressing the tab key)
ListPlayers > renders a list with id "players-list"
ListPlayers > renders a ListPlayer for each player in the players prop
ListPlayers > Listen for 'player-clicked' events from the ListPlayer component, and call the getPlayer prop function with the id of the clicked player as an argument.
RequestStatus component > should render the component, inside which is an element with id 'request-status'
testcase.system-err: [Vue warn]: Missing required prop: "status" at <RequestStatus ref="VTU_COMPONENT" > at <VTUROOT>

testcase.name: RequestStatus component > should render the component with the correct status
testcase.system-err: [Vue warn]: Missing required prop: "status" at <RequestStatus ref="VTU_COMPONENT" > at <VTUROOT>

testcase.name: SelectedPlayer > displays the selected player information when a player is passed as a prop with correct ui
SelectedPlayer > should not render if selected player is null
SelectedPlayer > emits a "delete-player" event with the player id when the delete button is clicked
SelectedPlayer > emits a "put-player" event with the updated player active state when the update button is clicked
SelectedPlayer > should not call handleUpdate if checkbox is clicked twice (aka player state is not changed)
